title: 6 things to do this weekend
text:
6 things to do this weekend 24th Oct 2015 6:00 AM HOT WHEELS: Mick Santin and Mitchell Haynes battle it out on the speedway track. PHOTO: CONTRIBUTED Related Items 
Grafton to Inverell Cycle Classic 
Prince Street, Grafton 
Saturday, 8am 
THE toughest one day cycling race in Australia! Starting on the banks of the Clarence River in downtown Grafton and finishing a gruelling 228km later in Inverell, after a scenic yet challenging ride over the Gibraltar Range. 
Phone Nigel Blake on 0408092592 for further details. 
2 
Grafton Speedway 
Saturday, Gates open 3pm 
Speedway is on again this Saturday night with the V8 Dirt Modified Series. There will be Street Stocks, Junior Sedans, AMCA Nationals, Wingless Sprint, Limited Sedans, National 4's and Production Sedans. 
Phone David Lander on 0408222906 for further details. 
3 
Grafton Model Aircraft Club 
Saturday and Sunday, 7am-2pm 
If you would like to learn to fly a radio controlled model aircraft, the Grafton Model Aircraft Club will be holding a pilot training day. 
Phone Daryl Woolfe on 66423600 for further details. 
4 
Next to public school Prescott St, Copmanhurst 
Sunday, 1pm-3pm 
Open the fourth Sunday of every month, this weekend is your chance to check out the specialist display of history and horse memorabilia including original Copmanhurst saddler Burt Leighton's saddlers chair and work bench and of course those saddles. 
Phone on 6647 3121 for further details. 
5 
Carrs Peninsula 
Sunday, 10am-3pm 
Enjoy a visit to this interesting rural museum, see the farm animals, and try the local olives $5pp U/12 free. Refreshments and homemade treats and gift shop open all day. 
Phone Don & Dorothy Enders on 6642 640 for further details. 
6 
Clocktower Hotel/GDSC 
Saturday night 
With country rock outfit the Adam Eckersley band with special guest Brooke McClymont in the Clocktower Hotel corner and soul queen Lisa Hunt and her band taking to the stage at the Grafton District Services Club for the very first time you can't lose either way really. 
Phone Clocktower on 66431122 or GDSC on 6643 2895 for further details. clarence valley
